Hi I am making a mod and I am having trouble animating multiple objects. I am use to animating characters with bones but I am trying to use just a simple position and rotate style for this part. The problem is, that they are all separate in the NLA Editor. Once I play the animation on the bottom, they are ALL combined into one. I just want the two shroud objects in one animation and the landing gear objects into one.

Edited July 7, 2014 by tygoo7

hi !

(i'm not an expert so may be i'm wrong ) !

In blender you can use the animation range 1 to 50 one animation and 50 to 100 others animation, but

it's still one animation !

In unity you can have two isolate animation, just go to ADD component -> miscellaneous -> animation or animator

In animation TAB , clic on ADD curve and name you're first animation . for this component

select the others game object or component (not sure if it's exactly this), and add an other animation or animator

go back in animation tab.

You have already a parameter of the first animation but if you click on the name of the animation (next to sample parameter)

you have the choice to create a new clip with other name completely independent.

And you can access these animation by the name in module part.

@+

You can also create multiple separate animations within the same .blend via the Dopesheet View using the Action Editor

[Eelstork tutorial] [Stackexchange thread on multiple animations]

I'm not sure about importing them to Unity though as I haven't done a multiple animation part yet
Thanks for the tips, but I actually did figure a way to make this work by just using bones parented to the objects.

Regarding the use of multiple animations

Because of the exact method that all KSP functions play animations with, you cannot play 2+ animations on 1 part concurrently without a mod

Whichever one plays second effectively cancels the first and sometimes resets it to a given position.
